text: Streams of water \add are\add* the heart\f + \fr 21:1 \ft Or “mind” \f* of a king in the hand of Yahweh;
⸤wherever⸥\f + \fr 21:1 \ft Literally “upon all that” \f* he will desire, he will turn.
Every way of a man is upright in his \add own\add* eyes,
but Yahweh weighs hearts.\f + \fr 21:2 \ft Or “minds” \f*
Doing righteousness and justice is \add more\add* acceptable
to Yahweh than sacrifice.
Haughtiness of \add the\add* eyes and pride of heart,
\add the\add* lamp of the wicked \add are\add* sin.
The plans of the diligent only \add lead\add* to abundance,
but all who are hasty, only to want.
He who makes treasure by a lying tongue
\add is a\add* fleeting vapor \add and\add* seeker\f + \fr 21:6 \ft Hebrew “seekers” \f* of death.
The violence of the wicked will sweep them away,
for they refuse to do justice.
Crooked is the way of a man and a foreigner,
but the pure \add is\add* upright \add in\add* his conduct.
Better to dwell on the corner of a roof
than \add to\add* share a house with a woman\f + \fr 21:9 \ft Or “wife” \f* of contention.
The soul\f + \fr 21:10 \ft Or “soul, life, throat” \f* of the wicked desires evil;
his neighbor will not find mercy in his eyes.
With the punishment of a scoffer, the simple will become wise,
and with the instruction of the wise, he will obtain knowledge.
The righteous observes the house of the wicked;
he throws the wicked to ruin.
He who closes his ear from the cry of the poor,
he also will cry out and not be heard.
A gift in secret\f + \fr 21:14 \ft Hebrew “the secret” \f* will avert ⸤anger⸥,\f + \fr 21:14 \ft Literally “nostril” \f*
and a ⸤concealed bribe⸥,\f + \fr 21:14 \ft Literally “bribe in the bosom” \f* strong wrath.
\add It is\add* a joy to the righteous to do justice,
but dismay to those who do evil.
Whoever wanders from the way of understanding,
in the assembly of the dead\f + \fr 21:16 \ft Or “Rephaim” \f* he will rest.
A man of want \add is\add* he who loves pleasure;
he who loves wine and oil\f + \fr 21:17 \ft Or “fat” \f* will not become rich.
A ransom for the righteous is the wicked,
and \add the\add* faithless instead of the upright.
Better to live in a land of wilderness
than \add with\add* a wife of quarrels and provocation.
Precious treasure and oil \add are\add* in the house of the wise,
but the foolish person\f + \fr 21:20 \ft Or “foolish of mankind” \f* will devour them.\f + \fr 21:20 \ft Literally “it” \f*
He who pursues righteousness and kindness
will find life, righteousness, and honor.
To a city of warriors, the wise ascends,
and he will bring down the stronghold—its object of trust.
He who guards his mouth and his tongue,
he guards his life\f + \fr 21:23 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f* from danger.
The proud, haughty one: “scoffer” \add is\add* his name;
he acts with arrogance of pride.
The craving of a lazy person will kill him,
for his hands refuse to work.\f + \fr 21:25 \ft Or “make” \f*
⸤All day⸥\f + \fr 21:26 \ft Literally “All the day” \f* he craves a craving,
but the righteous will give and not hold back.
The sacrifice of the wicked \add is\add* an abomination;
how much more when he brings it in divisiveness!
A false witness will perish,
but a man who listens will testify with\f + \fr 21:28 \ft Hebrew “to the” \f* success.
A wicked man is strong in ⸤his countenance⸥,\f + \fr 21:29 \ft Literally “his face” \f*
but the upright will appoint his paths.
There is no wisdom, nor understanding,
nor counsel to oppose Yahweh.
A horse is prepared for the day of battle,
but to Yahweh \add belongs\add* the victory.
